metadata.synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard and Counsellor Florrick;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

2.speaker: Cordula Eltan
2.text: Wyll Ravengard - the stain of Baldur's Gate.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

91.speaker: Cordula Eltan
91.text: To think your father's blood flows through those damnable veins.
91.context: NodeContext: In both recognition and shock.

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: Cordula Eltan? By the Nine Hells, what are you on about?
36.context: NodeContext: In both recognition and shock.

39.speaker: Cordula Eltan
39.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan and her allies ready for battle.

75.speaker: Cordula Eltan
75.text: How you mean to make the city bow to you and you alone.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan and her allies ready for battle.

1.speaker: Wyll
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan and her allies ready for battle.

17.speaker: Cordula Eltan
17.text: Shut it. My family's duty is to Baldur's Gate. I won't have the Hells' errand boy poison my city!
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan and her allies ready for battle.

52.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Eltan. I am my father's son. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

54.speaker: Cordula Eltan
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

50.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

3.speaker: Cordula Eltan
3.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

47.speaker: Cordula Eltan
47.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

29.speaker: Cordula Eltan
29.text: Wyll, there's something you should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.

10.speaker: Cordula Eltan
10.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but as usual he realised the danger before anyone else did.

87.speaker: Cordula Eltan
87.text: He understood that if the cult would be successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

26.speaker: Cordula Eltan
26.text: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the champion would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be you.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

24.speaker: Cordula Eltan
24.text: A bronze dragon, to be precise. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

7.speaker: Cordula Eltan
7.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

21.speaker: Cordula Eltan
21.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

35.speaker: Cordula Eltan
35.text: Since then, the city faced countless threats, but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. Until now.

48.speaker: Cordula Eltan
48.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

55.speaker: Cordula Eltan
55.text: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

8.speaker: Cordula Eltan
8.text: Let it set the path before you.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead, Eltan.

25.speaker: Cordula Eltan
25.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

89.speaker: Cordula Eltan
89.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

73.speaker: Cordula Eltan
73.text: May your father's courage be with you. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's dead.

70.speaker: Cordula Eltan
70.text: Dead? So once more, fortune turns against us.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

58.speaker: Cordula Eltan
58.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: You're going to trust him? The man who made a pact with a devil?

11.speaker: Cordula Eltan
11.text: Ravengard's blood runs through Wyll's veins. I choose to trust. I hope you choose to honour it.

5.speaker: Cordula Eltan
5.text: I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.

64.speaker: Cordula Eltan
64.text: Free the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. May Lady Tymora smile upon you.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Wyll? What do you make of this?

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: Baldur's Gate stands on the brink of the abyss. We'll need all the help we can get. Let's awaken the wyrm, and take back the city.

45.speaker: Cordula Eltan
45.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

78.speaker: Cordula Eltan
78.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.

86.speaker: Cordula Eltan
86.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

15.speaker: Cordula Eltan
15.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you're to bear his legacy, you must release the wyrm.

85.speaker: Cordula Eltan
85.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

90.speaker: Cordula Eltan
90.text: Find it, and let it set its path before you.

79.speaker: Wyll
79.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. I remember the lessons well. Father made me recite them every morning.

22.speaker: Cordula Eltan
22.text: It is said that only a true champion of Baldur's Gate can awaken the wyrm.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I believe Ravengard's still alive. And I intend to save him.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Mizora lied to you. We wanted to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

0.speaker: Cordula Eltan
0.text: It's true, Eltan. You can't believe her. She's a devil. Will you really trust her word over mine?

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: It's true, Eltan. You can't believe her. She's a devil. Will you really trust her word over mine?

65.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

14.speaker: Cordula Eltan
14.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

56.speaker: Cordula Eltan
56.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

81.speaker: Cordula Eltan
81.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

19.speaker: Cordula Eltan
19.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

31.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

46.speaker: Cordula Eltan
46.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

59.speaker: Cordula Eltan
59.text: I am Cordula Eltan, heir to the hero who forged the Fist.

57.speaker: Cordula Eltan
57.text: And you are the Hells' lowest dregs. I will not let you take the city!

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Cordula Eltan. Your family has a storied history in this city.

71.speaker: Cordula Eltan
71.text: My great grandfather built the Fist and forged its first blades.

30.speaker: Cordula Eltan
30.text: A man of honour - much like your father, Wyll. How cold is your heart, that you'd be his butcher?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.
